definition[0]: a hollow area in the surface of something, usually made by something hitting it
example[0]: There was a large dent in the passenger door.
definition[1]: a reduction in the amount of something
example[1]: The trip made a big dent in our savings.
example[2]: Eight years of effort have hardly put a dent in drug trafficking.
definition[2]: if you dent something, or if it dents, you hit or press it so that its surface is bent inwards
example[3]: No one was injured, but the car was scratched and dented.
example[4]: The scandal has dented his reputation.
